Description: Cypro-Phoenician glazed composition (faience) amulet; mould-made and glazed with a blue-green slip; seated figure of Isis nursing Horus or Harpocrates; perforated for suspension at the neck.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Turner Bequest Excavations, Amathus
Curator's comments: For other examples from Amathus, see Clerc 1991, 106-8 and passim. Clerc et al. 1976, 117 discusses examples from the sanctuary of Kition-Kition. Both Forgeau (171-6) and Lagarce (in Clerc et al. 1976, 167-74) provide useful overviews of the use and significance of Egyptianizing pendants and scarabs on Cyprus which often differ from those found in Egyptian contexts. Bibliography: Forgeau A. 1986, 'Scarabées, scaraboïdes et cônes', in R. Laffineur et al., Amathonte III. Testimonia 3 (Paris), 135-176. Clerc G. 1991, 'Aegyptiaca', in eds V. Karageorghis et al., La nécrople d'Amathonte Tombes 110-385. V (Nicosia), 1-50. Clerc G. et al. 1976, Fouilles de Kition. II. Objets égyptiens et égyptisants (Nicosia).
Bibliographic references: Murray, Smith and Walters 1900 / Excavations in Cyprus (p.118, Tomb 48)
